contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} '''Ellen Auerbach''' (May 20, 1906, [[Karlsruhe]], [[Germany]] â€“ July 30, 2004, [[New York City]]) was a German-born [[United States|American]] [[photographer]] who is best remembered for her innovative artwork for the [[Ringl & Pit]] studio in [[Berlin]] during the [[Weimar Republic]]. ==External links== * Clara Sandler and Juan Mandelbaum, [http://jwa.org/encyclopedia/article/auerbach-ellen an entry about Ellen Auerbach], Jewish Women: A Comprehensive Historical Encyclopedia {{Authority control|VIAF=54968270}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Auerbach, Ellen | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = May 20, 1906 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = July 30, 2004 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Auerbach, Ellen}} [[Category:1906 births]] [[Category:2004 deaths]] [[Category:American photographers]] [[Category:Modern artists]] [[Category:Women photographers]] {{US-photographer-stub}}
